title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that the low-level atmospheric disturbance to the east of the island has developed into a low-pressure system.

title: Thousands protest crime and corruption in Mexico City as ‘Gen Z’ protests gain momentum
byline: A few thousand people took to the streets of Mexico City on Saturday to protest growing crime, corruption and impunity in a protest organized by members of Generation Z, but which ended with strong backing from older supporters of opposition parties.

title: Southern Province Governor Bandula Harischandra passes away
byline: The Governor of the Southern Province, Bandula Harischandra, has passed away at the age of 62, sources confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourism earnings reach US$ 2.65 bln in first ten months of 2025
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has reported that total tourism earnings for the first ten months of 2025 amounted to US$ 2,659 million.

title: Police seek assistance to arrest suspect for attempted sexual assault of foreign tourist
byline: Sri Lanka Police are seeking public assistance to apprehend a suspect involved in the attempted sexual assault of a foreign national woman.

title: CAA seals warehouse in Wattala over imported dried chillies unsuitable for consumption
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has sealed a warehouse in Wattala where a stock of dried chillies suspected to be unfit for human consumption was being stored.

title: Refugees to face 20-year wait to settle permanently in UK under asylum reforms
byline: People granted asylum in the UK will have to wait 20 years before they can apply to settle permanently, under plans due to be announced by Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood on Monday.

title: Lebanon to file UN complaint over Israeli border wall
byline: Lebanon has said it will file a complaint to the UN Security Council over Israel’s construction of a concrete wall along the southern border that Beirut says extends beyond the UN-mapped Blue Line.

title: Leonid meteor shower to dazzle Sri Lankan skies today
byline: The Leonid meteor shower, the largest meteor shower visible in 2025 can be observed at midnight today (16) and early tomorrow morning, says Astronomer and Senior Lecturer Gihan Weerasekara.

title: Another 1,100 persons arrested in anti-drug raids
byline: More than 1,100 individuals have been arrested yesterday (15) during the nationwide operation launched to eradicate drugs from the country under the theme “A Nation United”.

title: Man arrested with firearm and ammunition in Chilaw
byline: An individual has been arrested for being in possession of a firearm and ammunition without a license by the Chilaw Divisional Investigation Unit.

title: Printing of driver’s licenses which was suspended due to shortage of cards resumes
byline: The printing of driver’s licenses, which had been suspended due to the shortage of printing cards, has resumed.

title: Man dies in accident on Ella–Wellawaya road
byline: An individual has died when a three-wheeler collided with a car at the third mile post along the Ella–Wellawaya main road.

title: GMOA to launch trade union action tomorrow
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to launch trade union action from tomorrow (17).

title: Businessman arrested in Kurana with foreign-made firearm
byline: A businessman has been arrested in Kurana, Negombo with a foreign-made firearm approximately 6 inches in length, police stated.

title: Weather advisory issued for heavy rainfall
byline: An ‘Amber’ level advisory for heavy rains for the next 24 hours has been issued by the Department of Meteorology.

title: US immigration raids begin in Charlotte, North Carolina
byline: US Federal authorities conducted raids on Saturday in the banking hub of Charlotte, North Carolina, the Department of Homeland Security said, expanding its crackdown on illegal immigration to the U.S. South.

title: Donald Trump weighs tighter green card rules for citizens of travel-ban nations
byline: The US administration is reportedly preparing a new immigration policy that could sharply restrict green card and other status benefits for people from countries already listed under President Donald Trump’s travel ban.

title: Israel reiterates opposition to Palestinian state before UN vote
byline: Israel on Sunday reaffirmed its opposition to the creation of a Palestinian state, a day before the United Nations Security Council is scheduled to vote on a U.S.-backed resolution supporting the so-called 20-point Gaza peace plan. Hamas later condemned the remarks, saying they revealed Israel’s “expansionist tendencies.”

title: Final rites of late Southern Province Governor on Tuesday
byline: The final rites of the late Governor of the Southern Province, Bandula Harischandra will be held at the Samanala Stadium in Galle on Tuesday.

title: Youth drowns while bathing in seas off Galle Face Green
byline: One of the two individuals who were rescued and hospitalized after being swept away by currents while bathing at the Galle Face beach in Colombo has passed away.

title: Storm Claudia kills three in Portugal, causes flooding in Britain
byline: Violent weather brought on by Storm Claudia killed three people and injured dozens in Portugal, authorities there said on Saturday, while in Britain rescue workers were organising evacuations due to heavy flooding in Wales and England.

title: Drug-prevention committees to be established in all schools and universities
byline: A circular will be issued to establish drug-prevention committees in all schools and universities across the country, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala stated.

title: PM Harini participates in Armed Forces Remembrance Day and Poppy Flower Ceremony
byline: The 81st Armed Forces Remembrance Day and Poppy Flower Ceremony was commemorated today at the Cenotaph War Memorial in Viharamahadevi Park, Colombo.

title: Viral video of sexual assault attempt on female tourist: Suspect, father of one, arrested
byline: A 25-year-old individual, a father of one, has been arrested on charges of an attempted sexual assault of a foreign national woman in the Thirukkovil area, after a video of the incident was widely circulated on social media.

title: India arrests suspect in New Delhi car blast that killed 10
byline: India’s anti-terror investigating agency said Sunday it arrested a man from Indian-controlled Kashmir on suspicion of conspiring with a suicide bomber to carry out a deadly car blast in the capital New Delhi.
